author: Beth Abbit
title: Inquest into death of ex-GMP officer who found his colleagues murdered by Dale Cregan - latest updates
text:
The inquest has heard that the cause of Mr Summerscales’ death was hanging. 10:52 Post-traumatic stress disorder 
Dr Ellis, who was Andrew Summerscales’ GP, said he had been diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) after the death of PCs Hughes and Bone. 
She told the court that Mr Summerscales said he had been thinking about leaving the police force because ‘leaving that environment was the only way he could recover from what had happened’. 
She said Mr Summerscales had been prescribed antidepressants. Dr Ellis said he had spoken to her about suicidal thoughts ‘on several occasions’ but said he had never done anything. 10:42 KEY EVENT When officers were murdered, 'his life changed' 
The inquest has been told that Mr Summerscales was ‘very good friends’ with Pcs Nicola Hughes and Fiona Bone Pc Fiona Bone (left) and Pc Nicola Hughes 
Joshua said their deaths affected his father greatly and from that point on ‘his life changed’ as he struggled to come to terms with it. Joshua had not realised how affected his father had been by the events, and was given the impression that he was coping. 
When Mr Summerscales left GMP in 2015 he started working as a delivery driver. Joshua said there was never any indication that his father was struggling. 10:39 'Very hard working' 
Mr Summerscales’ son Joshua has told the court that his father was brought up in Oldham and joined GMP in 2001. 
Joshua described him as very hard working, loyal and early on in his career loved his job. He loved motorbikes and football and was a Liverpool FC fan who had been at Hillsborough during the tragedy, his son tells the coroner. 
Joshua and Andrew had attended the Hillsborough memorial service at Anfield a couple of years ago and spoke about the tragedy ‘now and again’. 10:31 Inquest to begin shortly 
Coroner Joanne Kearsley has offered her condolences to the members of Mr Summerscales’ family, many of whom have attended today. Share
